member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.DeleteOptionsV1
member.summary: DeleteOptions may be provided when deleting an API object.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DeleteOptionsV1.GracePeriodSeconds
member.summary: The duration in seconds before the object should be deleted. Value must be non-negative integer. The value zero indicates delete immediately. If this value is nil, the default grace period for the specified type will be used. Defaults to a per object value if not specified. zero means delete immediately.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DeleteOptionsV1.OrphanDependents
member.summary: Deprecated: please use the PropagationPolicy, this field will be deprecated in 1.7. Should the dependent objects be orphaned. If true/false, the "orphan" finalizer will be added to/removed from the object's finalizers list. Either this field or PropagationPolicy may be set, but not both.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DeleteOptionsV1.Preconditions
member.summary: Must be fulfilled before a deletion is carried out. If not possible, a 409 Conflict status will be returned.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DeleteOptionsV1.PropagationPolicy
member.summary: Whether and how garbage collection will be performed. Either this field or OrphanDependents may be set, but not both. The default policy is decided by the existing finalizer set in the metadata.finalizers and the resource-specific default policy.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.DeletePropagationPolicy
member.summary: Well-known policies for propagating deletion of a resource to its children.

member.name: F:KubeClient.Models.DeletePropagationPolicy.Orphan
member.summary: Do not delete child resources.

member.name: F:KubeClient.Models.DeletePropagationPolicy.Foreground
member.summary: Delete child resources in the foreground; parent's deletion will not complete until child resources have been deleted.

member.name: F:KubeClient.Models.DeletePropagationPolicy.Background
member.summary: Delete child resources in the foreground; child resources will be deleted asynchronously.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.AllowedFlexVolumeV1Beta1
member.summary: AllowedFlexVolume represents a single Flexvolume that is allowed to be used.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.AllowedFlexVolumeV1Beta1.Driver
member.summary: driver is the name of the Flexvolume driver.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.AllowedHostPathV1Beta1
member.summary: AllowedHostPath defines the host volume conditions that will be enabled by a policy for pods to use. It requires the path prefix to be defined.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.AllowedHostPathV1Beta1.PathPrefix
member.summary:
pathPrefix is the path prefix that the host volume must match. It does not support `*`. Trailing slashes are trimmed when validating the path prefix with a host path.
Examples: `/foo` would allow `/foo`, `/foo/` and `/foo/bar` `/foo` would not allow `/food` or `/etc/foo`

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.AllowedHostPathV1Beta1.ReadOnly
member.summary: when set to true, will allow host volumes matching the pathPrefix only if all volume mounts are readOnly.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.APIGroupListV1
member.summary: APIGroupList is a list of APIGroup, to allow clients to discover the API at /apis.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIGroupListV1.Groups
member.summary: groups is a list of APIGroup.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.APIGroupV1
member.summary: APIGroup contains the name, the supported versions, and the preferred version of a group.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIGroupV1.Name
member.summary: name is the name of the group.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIGroupV1.PreferredVersion
member.summary: preferredVersion is the version preferred by the API server, which probably is the storage version.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIGroupV1.ServerAddressByClientCIDRs
member.summary: a map of client CIDR to server address that is serving this group. This is to help clients reach servers in the most network-efficient way possible. Clients can use the appropriate server address as per the CIDR that they match. In case of multiple matches, clients should use the longest matching CIDR. The server returns only those CIDRs that it thinks that the client can match. For example: the master will return an internal IP CIDR only, if the client reaches the server using an internal IP. Server looks at X-Forwarded-For header or X-Real-Ip header or request.RemoteAddr (in that order) to get the client IP.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.APIGroupV1.ShouldSerializeServerAddressByClientCIDRs
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIGroupV1.Versions
member.summary: versions are the versions supported in this group.

member.summary: groupVersion is the group and version this APIResourceList is for.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIResourceListV1.Resources

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.APIResourceV1

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIResourceV1.Kind
member.summary: kind is the kind for the resource (e.g. 'Foo' is the kind for a resource 'foo')

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIResourceV1.Namespaced
member.summary: namespaced indicates if a resource is namespaced or not.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIResourceV1.Name
member.summary: name is the plural name of the resource.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIResourceV1.SingularName
member.summary: singularName is the singular name of the resource. This allows clients to handle plural and singular opaquely. The singularName is more correct for reporting status on a single item and both singular and plural are allowed from the kubectl CLI interface.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIResourceV1.Version
member.summary: version is the preferred version of the resource. Empty implies the version of the containing resource list For subresources, this may have a different value, for example: v1 (while inside a v1beta1 version of the core resource's group)".

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIResourceV1.Group
member.summary: group is the preferred group of the resource. Empty implies the group of the containing resource list. For subresources, this may have a different value, for example: Scale".

member.summary: categories is a list of the grouped resources this resource belongs to (e.g. 'all')

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.APIServiceSpecV1
member.summary: APIServiceSpec contains information for locating and communicating with a server. Only https is supported, though you are able to disable certificate verification.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIServiceSpecV1.CaBundle
member.summary: CABundle is a PEM encoded CA bundle which will be used to validate an API server's serving certificate.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIServiceSpecV1.Service
member.summary: Service is a reference to the service for this API server. It must communicate on port 443 If the Service is nil, that means the handling for the API groupversion is handled locally on this server. The call will simply delegate to the normal handler chain to be fulfilled.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIServiceSpecV1.GroupPriorityMinimum
member.summary: GroupPriorityMininum is the priority this group should have at least. Higher priority means that the group is preferred by clients over lower priority ones. Note that other versions of this group might specify even higher GroupPriorityMininum values such that the whole group gets a higher priority. The primary sort is based on GroupPriorityMinimum, ordered highest number to lowest (20 before 10). The secondary sort is based on the alphabetical comparison of the name of the object. (v1.bar before v1.foo) We'd recommend something like: *.k8s.io (except extensions) at 18000 and PaaSes (OpenShift, Deis) are recommended to be in the 2000s

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIServiceSpecV1.Version
member.summary: Version is the API version this server hosts. For example, "v1"

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIServiceSpecV1.Group
member.summary: Group is the API group name this server hosts

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIServiceSpecV1.InsecureSkipTLSVerify
member.summary: InsecureSkipTLSVerify disables TLS certificate verification when communicating with this server. This is strongly discouraged. You should use the CABundle instead.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIServiceSpecV1.VersionPriority
member.summary: VersionPriority controls the ordering of this API version inside of its group. Must be greater than zero. The primary sort is based on VersionPriority, ordered highest to lowest (20 before 10). Since it's inside of a group, the number can be small, probably in the 10s. In case of equal version priorities, the version string will be used to compute the order inside a group. If the version string is "kube-like", it will sort above non "kube-like" version strings, which are ordered lexicographically. "Kube-like" versions start with a "v", then are followed by a number (the major version), then optionally the string "alpha" or "beta" and another number (the minor version). These are sorted first by GA > beta > alpha (where GA is a version with no suffix such as beta or alpha), and then by comparing major version, then minor version. An example sorted list of versions: v10, v2, v1, v11beta2, v10beta3, v3beta1, v12alpha1, v11alpha2, foo1, foo10.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.APIVersionsV1
member.summary: APIVersions lists the versions that are available, to allow clients to discover the API at /api, which is the root path of the legacy v1 API.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.APIVersionsV1.ServerAddressByClientCIDRs
member.summary: a map of client CIDR to server address that is serving this group. This is to help clients reach servers in the most network-efficient way possible. Clients can use the appropriate server address as per the CIDR that they match. In case of multiple matches, clients should use the longest matching CIDR. The server returns only those CIDRs that it thinks that the client can match. For example: the master will return an internal IP CIDR only, if the client reaches the server using an internal IP. Server looks at X-Forwarded-For header or X-Real-Ip header or request.RemoteAddr (in that order) to get the client IP.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.AWSElasticBlockStoreVolumeSourceV1
member.summary:
Represents a Persistent Disk resource in AWS.
An AWS EBS disk must exist before mounting to a container. The disk must also be in the same AWS zone as the kubelet. An AWS EBS disk can only be mounted as read/write once. AWS EBS volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.AWSElasticBlockStoreVolumeSourceV1.VolumeID
member.summary: Unique ID of the persistent disk resource in AWS (Amazon EBS volume). More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.AWSElasticBlockStoreVolumeSourceV1.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type of the volume that you want to mount. Tip: Ensure that the filesystem type is supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.AWSElasticBlockStoreVolumeSourceV1.Partition
member.summary: The partition in the volume that you want to mount. If omitted, the default is to mount by volume name. Examples: For volume /dev/sda1, you specify the partition as "1". Similarly, the volume partition for /dev/sda is "0" (or you can leave the property empty).

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.AWSElasticBlockStoreVolumeSourceV1.ReadOnly
member.summary: Specify "true" to force and set the ReadOnly property in VolumeMounts to "true". If omitted, the default is "false". More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#awselasticblockstore

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.AzureDiskVolumeSourceV1.CachingMode

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.AzureDiskVolumeSourceV1.DiskName

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.AzureDiskVolumeSourceV1.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.AzureDiskVolumeSourceV1.ReadOnly

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.ConfigMapProjectionV1
member.summary:
Adapts a ConfigMap into a projected volume.
The contents of the target ConfigMap's Data field will be presented in a projected volume as files using the keys in the Data field as the file names, unless the items element is populated with specific mappings of keys to paths. Note that this is identical to a configmap volume source without the default mode.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ConfigMapProjectionV1.Name
member.summary: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ConfigMapProjectionV1.Optional
member.summary: Specify whether the ConfigMap or it's keys must be defined

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ConfigMapProjectionV1.Items
member.summary: If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced ConfigMap will be projected into the volume as a file whose name is the key and content is the value. If specified, the listed keys will be projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys will not be present. If a key is specified which is not present in the ConfigMap, the volume setup will error unless it is marked optional. Paths must be relative and may not contain the '..' path or start with '..'.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.ConfigMapProjectionV1.ShouldSerializeItems
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.ConfigMapV1
member.summary: ConfigMap holds configuration data for pods to consume.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ConfigMapV1.BinaryData
member.summary: BinaryData contains the binary data. Each key must consist of alphanumeric characters, '-', '_' or '.'. BinaryData can contain byte sequences that are not in the UTF-8 range. The keys stored in BinaryData must not overlap with the ones in the Data field, this is enforced during validation process. Using this field will require 1.10+ apiserver and kubelet.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.ConfigMapV1.ShouldSerializeBinaryData
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ConfigMapV1.Data
member.summary: Data contains the configuration data. Each key must consist of alphanumeric characters, '-', '_' or '.'. Values with non-UTF-8 byte sequences must use the BinaryData field. The keys stored in Data must not overlap with the keys in the BinaryData field, this is enforced during validation process.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.ConfigMapV1.ShouldSerializeData
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.ConfigMapVolumeSourceV1
member.summary:
Adapts a ConfigMap into a volume.
The contents of the target ConfigMap's Data field will be presented in a volume as files using the keys in the Data field as the file names, unless the items element is populated with specific mappings of keys to paths. ConfigMap volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ConfigMapVolumeSourceV1.DefaultMode
member.summary: Optional: mode bits to use on created files by default. Must be a value between 0 and 0777. Defaults to 0644. Directories within the path are not affected by this setting. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ConfigMapVolumeSourceV1.Name
member.summary: Name of the referent. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ConfigMapVolumeSourceV1.Optional
member.summary: Specify whether the ConfigMap or it's keys must be defined

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ConfigMapVolumeSourceV1.Items
member.summary: If unspecified, each key-value pair in the Data field of the referenced ConfigMap will be projected into the volume as a file whose name is the key and content is the value. If specified, the listed keys will be projected into the specified paths, and unlisted keys will not be present. If a key is specified which is not present in the ConfigMap, the volume setup will error unless it is marked optional. Paths must be relative and may not contain the '..' path or start with '..'.

member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.summary: The number of times the container has been restarted, currently based on the number of dead containers that have not yet been removed. Note that this is calculated from dead containers. But those containers are subject to garbage collection. This value will get capped at 5 by GC.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerStatusV1.Ready
member.summary: Specifies whether the container has passed its readiness probe.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1
member.summary: A single application container that you want to run within a pod.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.Command
member.summary: Entrypoint array. Not executed within a shell. The docker image's ENTRYPOINT is used if this is not provided. Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container's environment. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/inject-data-application/define-command-argument-container/#running-a-command-in-a-shell

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.ShouldSerializeCommand
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.Image
member.summary: Docker image name. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images This field is optional to allow higher level config management to default or override container images in workload controllers like Deployments and StatefulSets.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.Lifecycle
member.summary: Actions that the management system should take in response to container lifecycle events. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.LivenessProbe
member.summary: Periodic probe of container liveness. Container will be restarted if the probe fails. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.Name
member.summary: Name of the container specified as a DNS_LABEL. Each container in a pod must have a unique name (DNS_LABEL). Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.ReadinessProbe
member.summary: Periodic probe of container service readiness. Container will be removed from service endpoints if the probe fails. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/pods/pod-lifecycle#container-probes

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.StdinOnce
member.summary: Whether the container runtime should close the stdin channel after it has been opened by a single attach. When stdin is true the stdin stream will remain open across multiple attach sessions. If stdinOnce is set to true, stdin is opened on container start, is empty until the first client attaches to stdin, and then remains open and accepts data until the client disconnects, at which time stdin is closed and remains closed until the container is restarted. If this flag is false, a container processes that reads from stdin will never receive an EOF. Default is false

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.TerminationMessagePath
member.summary: Optional: Path at which the file to which the container's termination message will be written is mounted into the container's filesystem. Message written is intended to be brief final status, such as an assertion failure message. Will be truncated by the node if greater than 4096 bytes. The total message length across all containers will be limited to 12kb. Defaults to /dev/termination-log. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.EnvFrom
member.summary: List of sources to populate environment variables in the container. The keys defined within a source must be a C_IDENTIFIER. All invalid keys will be reported as an event when the container is starting. When a key exists in multiple sources, the value associated with the last source will take precedence. Values defined by an Env with a duplicate key will take precedence. Cannot be updated.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.ShouldSerializeEnvFrom
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.Stdin
member.summary: Whether this container should allocate a buffer for stdin in the container runtime. If this is not set, reads from stdin in the container will always result in EOF. Default is false.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.WorkingDir
member.summary: Container's working directory. If not specified, the container runtime's default will be used, which might be configured in the container image. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.Args
member.summary: Arguments to the entrypoint. The docker image's CMD is used if this is not provided. Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the container's environment. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/inject-data-application/define-command-argument-container/#running-a-command-in-a-shell

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.ShouldSerializeArgs
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.Ports
member.summary: List of ports to expose from the container. Exposing a port here gives the system additional information about the network connections a container uses, but is primarily informational. Not specifying a port here DOES NOT prevent that port from being exposed. Any port which is listening on the default "0.0.0.0" address inside a container will be accessible from the network. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.ImagePullPolicy
member.summary: Image pull policy. One of Always, Never, IfNotPresent. Defaults to Always if :latest tag is specified, or IfNotPresent otherwise. Cannot be updated. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images#updating-images

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.TerminationMessagePolicy
member.summary: Indicate how the termination message should be populated. File will use the contents of terminationMessagePath to populate the container status message on both success and failure. FallbackToLogsOnError will use the last chunk of container log output if the termination message file is empty and the container exited with an error. The log output is limited to 2048 bytes or 80 lines, whichever is smaller. Defaults to File. Cannot be updated.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ContainerV1.Tty

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.ControllerRevisionV1
member.summary: ControllerRevision implements an immutable snapshot of state data. Clients are responsible for serializing and deserializing the objects that contain their internal state. Once a ControllerRevision has been successfully created, it can not be updated. The API Server will fail validation of all requests that attempt to mutate the Data field. ControllerRevisions may, however, be deleted. Note that, due to its use by both the DaemonSet and StatefulSet controllers for update and rollback, this object is beta. However, it may be subject to name and representation changes in future releases, and clients should not depend on its stability. It is primarily for internal use by controllers.

member.summary: Data is the serialized representation of the state.

member.summary: This flag tells the controller to suspend subsequent executions, it does not apply to already started executions. Defaults to false.

member.summary: Specifies the job that will be created when executing a CronJob.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CronJobSpecV1Beta1.Schedule
member.summary: The schedule in Cron format, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CronJobSpecV1Beta1.StartingDeadlineSeconds
member.summary: Optional deadline in seconds for starting the job if it misses scheduled time for any reason. Missed jobs executions will be counted as failed ones.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CronJobSpecV1Beta1.FailedJobsHistoryLimit
member.summary: The number of failed finished jobs to retain. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CronJobSpecV1Beta1.SuccessfulJobsHistoryLimit
member.summary: The number of successful finished jobs to retain. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 3.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CronJobSpecV1Beta1.ConcurrencyPolicy
member.summary: Specifies how to treat concurrent executions of a Job. Valid values are: - "Allow" (default): allows CronJobs to run concurrently; - "Forbid": forbids concurrent runs, skipping next run if previous run hasn't finished yet; - "Replace": cancels currently running job and replaces it with a new one

member.summary: CronJobSpec describes how the job execution will look like and when it will actually run.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CronJobSpecV2Alpha1.Suspend
member.summary: This flag tells the controller to suspend subsequent executions, it does not apply to already started executions. Defaults to false.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CronJobSpecV2Alpha1.JobTemplate
member.summary: Specifies the job that will be created when executing a CronJob.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CronJobSpecV2Alpha1.Schedule
member.summary: The schedule in Cron format, see https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cron.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CronJobSpecV2Alpha1.StartingDeadlineSeconds
member.summary: Optional deadline in seconds for starting the job if it misses scheduled time for any reason. Missed jobs executions will be counted as failed ones.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CronJobSpecV2Alpha1.FailedJobsHistoryLimit
member.summary: The number of failed finished jobs to retain. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CronJobSpecV2Alpha1.SuccessfulJobsHistoryLimit
member.summary: The number of successful finished jobs to retain. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CronJobSpecV2Alpha1.ConcurrencyPolicy
member.summary: Specifies how to treat concurrent executions of a Job. Valid values are: - "Allow" (default): allows CronJobs to run concurrently; - "Forbid": forbids concurrent runs, skipping next run if previous run hasn't finished yet; - "Replace": cancels currently running job and replaces it with a new one

member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs".

member.summary: VolumeHandle is the unique volume name returned by the CSI volume plugins CreateVolume to refer to the volume on all subsequent calls. Required.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CSIPersistentVolumeSourceV1.ControllerPublishSecretRef
member.summary: ControllerPublishSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI ControllerPublishVolume and ControllerUnpublishVolume calls. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CSIPersistentVolumeSourceV1.NodePublishSecretRef
member.summary: NodePublishSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI NodePublishVolume and NodeUnpublishVolume calls. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CSIPersistentVolumeSourceV1.NodeStageSecretRef
member.summary: NodeStageSecretRef is a reference to the secret object containing sensitive information to pass to the CSI driver to complete the CSI NodeStageVolume and NodeStageVolume and NodeUnstageVolume calls. This field is optional, and may be empty if no secret is required. If the secret object contains more than one secret, all secrets are passed.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CSIPersistentVolumeSourceV1.Driver
member.summary: Driver is the name of the driver to use for this volume. Required.

member.summary: Attributes of the volume to publish.

member.summary: Subresources describes the subresources for CustomResources

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CustomResourceDefinitionSpecV1Beta1.Versions
member.summary: Versions is the list of all supported versions for this resource. If Version field is provided, this field is optional. Validation: All versions must use the same validation schema for now. i.e., top level Validation field is applied to all of these versions. Order: The version name will be used to compute the order. If the version string is "kube-like", it will sort above non "kube-like" version strings, which are ordered lexicographically. "Kube-like" versions start with a "v", then are followed by a number (the major version), then optionally the string "alpha" or "beta" and another number (the minor version). These are sorted first by GA > beta > alpha (where GA is a version with no suffix such as beta or alpha), and then by comparing major version, then minor version. An example sorted list of versions: v10, v2, v1, v11beta2, v10beta3, v3beta1, v12alpha1, v11alpha2, foo1, foo10.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.CustomResourceDefinitionSpecV1Beta1.ShouldSerializeVersions

member.summary: AcceptedNames are the names that are actually being used to serve discovery They may be different than the names in spec.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CustomResourceDefinitionStatusV1Beta1.Conditions
member.summary: Conditions indicate state for particular aspects of a CustomResourceDefinition

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CustomResourceDefinitionStatusV1Beta1.StoredVersions
member.summary: StoredVersions are all versions of CustomResources that were ever persisted. Tracking these versions allows a migration path for stored versions in etcd. The field is mutable so the migration controller can first finish a migration to another version (i.e. that no old objects are left in the storage), and then remove the rest of the versions from this list. None of the versions in this list can be removed from the spec.Versions field.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.CustomResourceSubresourceScaleV1Beta1
member.summary: CustomResourceSubresourceScale defines how to serve the scale subresource for CustomResources.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CustomResourceSubresourceScaleV1Beta1.LabelSelectorPath
member.summary: LabelSelectorPath defines the JSON path inside of a CustomResource that corresponds to Scale.Status.Selector. Only JSON paths without the array notation are allowed. Must be a JSON Path under .status. Must be set to work with HPA. If there is no value under the given path in the CustomResource, the status label selector value in the /scale subresource will default to the empty string.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CustomResourceSubresourceScaleV1Beta1.SpecReplicasPath
member.summary: SpecReplicasPath defines the JSON path inside of a CustomResource that corresponds to Scale.Spec.Replicas. Only JSON paths without the array notation are allowed. Must be a JSON Path under .spec. If there is no value under the given path in the CustomResource, the /scale subresource will return an error on GET.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.CustomResourceSubresourceScaleV1Beta1.StatusReplicasPath
member.summary: StatusReplicasPath defines the JSON path inside of a CustomResource that corresponds to Scale.Status.Replicas. Only JSON paths without the array notation are allowed. Must be a JSON Path under .status. If there is no value under the given path in the CustomResource, the status replica value in the /scale subresource will default to 0.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.CustomResourceSubresourceStatusV1Beta1
member.summary: CustomResourceSubresourceStatus defines how to serve the status subresource for CustomResources. Status is represented by the `.status` JSON path inside of a CustomResource. When set, * exposes a /status subresource for the custom resource * PUT requests to the /status subresource take a custom resource object, and ignore changes to anything except the status stanza * PUT/POST/PATCH requests to the custom resource ignore changes to the status stanza

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DaemonSetSpecV1.Template
member.summary: An object that describes the pod that will be created. The DaemonSet will create exactly one copy of this pod on every node that matches the template's node selector (or on every node if no node selector is specified). More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/replicationcontroller#pod-template

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DaemonSetSpecV1.Selector
member.summary: A label query over pods that are managed by the daemon set. Must match in order to be controlled. It must match the pod template's labels. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DaemonSetSpecV1.MinReadySeconds
member.summary: The minimum number of seconds for which a newly created DaemonSet pod should be ready without any of its container crashing, for it to be considered available. Defaults to 0 (pod will be considered available as soon as it is ready).

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DaemonSetSpecV1.RevisionHistoryLimit
member.summary: The number of old history to retain to allow rollback. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 10.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DaemonSetSpecV1.UpdateStrategy
member.summary: An update strategy to replace existing DaemonSet pods with new pods.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.DeploymentSpecV1
member.summary: DeploymentSpec is the specification of the desired behavior of the Deployment.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DeploymentSpecV1.Paused
member.summary: Indicates that the deployment is paused.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DeploymentSpecV1.Template
member.summary: Template describes the pods that will be created.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DeploymentSpecV1.Selector
member.summary: Label selector for pods. Existing ReplicaSets whose pods are selected by this will be the ones affected by this deployment. It must match the pod template's labels.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DeploymentSpecV1.MinReadySeconds
member.summary: Minimum number of seconds for which a newly created pod should be ready without any of its container crashing, for it to be considered available. Defaults to 0 (pod will be considered available as soon as it is ready)

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DeploymentSpecV1.ProgressDeadlineSeconds
member.summary: The maximum time in seconds for a deployment to make progress before it is considered to be failed. The deployment controller will continue to process failed deployments and a condition with a ProgressDeadlineExceeded reason will be surfaced in the deployment status. Note that progress will not be estimated during the time a deployment is paused. Defaults to 600s.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DeploymentSpecV1.Replicas
member.summary: Number of desired pods. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DeploymentSpecV1.RevisionHistoryLimit
member.summary: The number of old ReplicaSets to retain to allow rollback. This is a pointer to distinguish between explicit zero and not specified. Defaults to 10.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DeploymentSpecV1.Strategy
member.summary: The deployment strategy to use to replace existing pods with new ones.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.DeploymentSpecV1Beta1
member.summary: DeploymentSpec is the specification of the desired behavior of the Deployment.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DeploymentSpecV1Beta1.Paused
member.summary: Indicates that the deployment is paused and will not be processed by the deployment controller.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DeploymentSpecV1Beta1.Template
member.summary: Template describes the pods that will be created.

member.summary: DEPRECATED. The config this deployment is rolling back to. Will be cleared after rollback is done.

member.summary: Minimum number of seconds for which a newly created pod should be ready without any of its container crashing, for it to be considered available. Defaults to 0 (pod will be considered available as soon as it is ready)

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DeploymentSpecV1Beta1.ProgressDeadlineSeconds

member.summary: Items is a list of DownwardAPIVolume file

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.DownwardAPIVolumeFileV1
member.summary: DownwardAPIVolumeFile represents information to create the file containing the pod field

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DownwardAPIVolumeFileV1.Mode
member.summary: Optional: mode bits to use on this file, must be a value between 0 and 0777. If not specified, the volume defaultMode will be used. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DownwardAPIVolumeFileV1.FieldRef
member.summary: Required: Selects a field of the pod: only annotations, labels, name and namespace are supported.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DownwardAPIVolumeFileV1.ResourceFieldRef
member.summary: Selects a resource of the container: only resources limits and requests (limits.cpu, limits.memory, requests.cpu and requests.memory) are currently supported.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DownwardAPIVolumeFileV1.Path
member.summary: Required: Path is the relative path name of the file to be created. Must not be absolute or contain the '..' path. Must be utf-8 encoded. The first item of the relative path must not start with '..'

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.DownwardAPIVolumeSourceV1
member.summary: DownwardAPIVolumeSource represents a volume containing downward API info. Downward API volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DownwardAPIVolumeSourceV1.DefaultMode
member.summary: Optional: mode bits to use on created files by default. Must be a value between 0 and 0777. Defaults to 0644. Directories within the path are not affected by this setting. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.DownwardAPIVolumeSourceV1.Items
member.summary: Items is a list of downward API volume file

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.DownwardAPIVolumeSourceV1.ShouldSerializeItems
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.EmptyDirVolumeSourceV1
member.summary: Represents an empty directory for a pod. Empty directory volumes support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.EmptyDirVolumeSourceV1.Medium
member.summary: What type of storage medium should back this directory. The default is "" which means to use the node's default medium. Must be an empty string (default) or Memory. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#emptydir

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.EmptyDirVolumeSourceV1.SizeLimit
member.summary: Total amount of local storage required for this EmptyDir volume. The size limit is also applicable for memory medium. The maximum usage on memory medium EmptyDir would be the minimum value between the SizeLimit specified here and the sum of memory limits of all containers in a pod. The default is nil which means that the limit is undefined. More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/volumes#emptydir

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.EndpointAddressV1
member.summary: EndpointAddress is a tuple that describes single IP address.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.EndpointAddressV1.Hostname
member.summary: The Hostname of this endpoint

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.EndpointAddressV1.NodeName
member.summary: Optional: Node hosting this endpoint. This can be used to determine endpoints local to a node.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.EndpointAddressV1.TargetRef
member.summary: Reference to object providing the endpoint.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.EndpointAddressV1.Ip
member.summary: The IP of this endpoint. May not be loopback (127.0.0.0/8), link-local (169.254.0.0/16), or link-local multicast ((224.0.0.0/24). IPv6 is also accepted but not fully supported on all platforms. Also, certain kubernetes components, like kube-proxy, are not IPv6 ready.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.EndpointPortV1
member.summary: EndpointPort is a tuple that describes a single port.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.EndpointPortV1.Name
member.summary: The name of this port (corresponds to ServicePort.Name). Must be a DNS_LABEL. Optional only if one port is defined.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.EndpointPortV1.Protocol
member.summary: The IP protocol for this port. Must be UDP or TCP. Default is TCP.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.EndpointPortV1.Port
member.summary: The port number of the endpoint.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.EndpointsListV1
member.summary: EndpointsList is a list of endpoints.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.EndpointsListV1.Items
member.summary: List of endpoints.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.EndpointSubsetV1
member.summary: EndpointSubset is a group of addresses with a common set of ports. The expanded set of endpoints is the Cartesian product of Addresses x Ports. For example, given: { Addresses: [{"ip": "10.10.1.1"}, {"ip": "10.10.2.2"}], Ports: [{"name": "a", "port": 8675}, {"name": "b", "port": 309}] } The resulting set of endpoints can be viewed as: a: [ 10.10.1.1:8675, 10.10.2.2:8675 ], b: [ 10.10.1.1:309, 10.10.2.2:309 ]

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.EndpointSubsetV1.Addresses
member.summary: IP addresses which offer the related ports that are marked as ready. These endpoints should be considered safe for load balancers and clients to utilize.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.EndpointSubsetV1.ShouldSerializeAddresses
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.EndpointSubsetV1.NotReadyAddresses
member.summary: IP addresses which offer the related ports but are not currently marked as ready because they have not yet finished starting, have recently failed a readiness check, or have recently failed a liveness check.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.EndpointSubsetV1.ShouldSerializeNotReadyAddresses
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.EndpointSubsetV1.Ports
member.summary: Port numbers available on the related IP addresses.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.EndpointSubsetV1.ShouldSerializePorts
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.EndpointsV1
P:KubeClient.Models.EndpointsV1.Subsets
member.summary: The set of all endpoints is the union of all subsets. Addresses are placed into subsets according to the IPs they share. A single address with multiple ports, some of which are ready and some of which are not (because they come from different containers) will result in the address being displayed in different subsets for the different ports. No address will appear in both Addresses and NotReadyAddresses in the same subset. Sets of addresses and ports that comprise a service.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.EndpointsV1.ShouldSerializeSubsets
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.summary: Selects a resource of the container: only resources limits and requests (limits.cpu, limits.memory, limits.ephemeral-storage, requests.cpu, requests.memory and requests.ephemeral-storage) are currently supported.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.EnvVarV1
member.summary: EnvVar represents an environment variable present in a Container.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.EnvVarV1.Name
member.summary: Name of the environment variable. Must be a C_IDENTIFIER.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.EnvVarV1.Value
member.summary: Variable references $(VAR_NAME) are expanded using the previous defined environment variables in the container and any service environment variables. If a variable cannot be resolved, the reference in the input string will be unchanged. The $(VAR_NAME) syntax can be escaped with a double $$, ie: $$(VAR_NAME). Escaped references will never be expanded, regardless of whether the variable exists or not. Defaults to "".

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.EnvVarV1.ValueFrom
member.summary: Source for the environment variable's value. Cannot be used if value is not empty.

member.summary: Eviction evicts a pod from its node subject to certain policies and safety constraints. This is a subresource of Pod. A request to cause such an eviction is created by POSTing to .../pods/<pod name>/evictions.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.ExecActionV1
member.summary: ExecAction describes a "run in container" action.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ExecActionV1.Command
member.summary: Command is the command line to execute inside the container, the working directory for the command is root ('/') in the container's filesystem. The command is simply exec'd, it is not run inside a shell, so traditional shell instructions ('|', etc) won't work. To use a shell, you need to explicitly call out to that shell. Exit status of 0 is treated as live/healthy and non-zero is unhealthy.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.GCEPersistentDiskVolumeSourceV1
member.summary:
Represents a Persistent Disk resource in Google Compute Engine.
A GCE PD must exist before mounting to a container. The disk must also be in the same GCE project and zone as the kubelet. A GCE PD can only be mounted as read/write once or read-only many times. GCE PDs support ownership management and SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.GCEPersistentDiskVolumeSourceV1.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type of the volume that you want to mount. Tip: Ensure that the filesystem type is supported by the host operating system. Examples: "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.GCEPersistentDiskVolumeSourceV1.PdName
member.summary: Unique name of the PD resource in GCE. Used to identify the disk in GCE. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.GCEPersistentDiskVolumeSourceV1.Partition
member.summary: The partition in the volume that you want to mount. If omitted, the default is to mount by volume name. Examples: For volume /dev/sda1, you specify the partition as "1". Similarly, the volume partition for /dev/sda is "0" (or you can leave the property empty). More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.GCEPersistentDiskVolumeSourceV1.ReadOnly
member.summary: ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts. Defaults to false. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes#gcepersistentdisk

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.GitRepoVolumeSourceV1
member.summary:
Represents a volume that is populated with the contents of a git repository. Git repo volumes do not support ownership management. Git repo volumes support SELinux relabeling.
DEPRECATED: GitRepo is deprecated. To provision a container with a git repo, mount an EmptyDir into an InitContainer that clones the repo using git, then mount the EmptyDir into the Pod's container.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.GitRepoVolumeSourceV1.Revision
member.summary: Commit hash for the specified revision.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.GitRepoVolumeSourceV1.Directory
member.summary: Target directory name. Must not contain or start with '..'. If '.' is supplied, the volume directory will be the git repository. Otherwise, if specified, the volume will contain the git repository in the subdirectory with the given name.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.GitRepoVolumeSourceV1.Repository
member.summary: Repository URL

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.GlusterfsVolumeSourceV1
member.summary: Represents a Glusterfs mount that lasts the lifetime of a pod. Glusterfs volumes do not support ownership management or SELinux relabeling.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.GlusterfsVolumeSourceV1.Path
member.summary: Path is the Glusterfs volume path. More info: https://releases.k8s.io/HEAD/examples/volumes/glusterfs/README.md#create-a-pod

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.GlusterfsVolumeSourceV1.Endpoints

member.summary: target average CPU utilization (represented as a percentage of requested CPU) over all the pods; if not specified the default autoscaling policy will be used.

member.summary: reference to scaled resource; horizontal pod autoscaler will learn the current resource consumption and will set the desired number of pods by using its Scale subresource.

member.summary: upper limit for the number of pods that can be set by the autoscaler; cannot be smaller than MinReplicas.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpecV1.MinReplicas
member.summary: lower limit for the number of pods that can be set by the autoscaler, default 1.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpecV2Beta1
member.summary: HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpec describes the desired functionality of the HorizontalPodAutoscaler.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpecV2Beta1.ScaleTargetRef
member.summary: scaleTargetRef points to the target resource to scale, and is used to the pods for which metrics should be collected, as well as to actually change the replica count.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpecV2Beta1.MaxReplicas
member.summary: maxReplicas is the upper limit for the number of replicas to which the autoscaler can scale up. It cannot be less that minReplicas.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpecV2Beta1.Metrics
member.summary: metrics contains the specifications for which to use to calculate the desired replica count (the maximum replica count across all metrics will be used). The desired replica count is calculated multiplying the ratio between the target value and the current value by the current number of pods. Ergo, metrics used must decrease as the pod count is increased, and vice-versa. See the individual metric source types for more information about how each type of metric must respond.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpecV2Beta1.ShouldSerializeMetrics
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.HorizontalPodAutoscalerSpecV2Beta1.MinReplicas
member.summary: minReplicas is the lower limit for the number of replicas to which the autoscaler can scale down. It defaults to 1 pod.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.HTTPIngressPathV1Beta1
member.summary: HTTPIngressPath associates a path regex with a backend. Incoming urls matching the path are forwarded to the backend.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.HTTPIngressPathV1Beta1.Backend
member.summary: Backend defines the referenced service endpoint to which the traffic will be forwarded to.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.HTTPIngressPathV1Beta1.Path
member.summary: Path is an extended POSIX regex as defined by IEEE Std 1003.1, (i.e this follows the egrep/unix syntax, not the perl syntax) matched against the path of an incoming request. Currently it can contain characters disallowed from the conventional "path" part of a URL as defined by RFC 3986. Paths must begin with a '/'. If unspecified, the path defaults to a catch all sending traffic to the backend.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.HTTPIngressRuleValueV1Beta1
member.summary: HTTPIngressRuleValue is a list of http selectors pointing to backends. In the example: http://<host>/<path>?<searchpart> -> backend where where parts of the url correspond to RFC 3986, this resource will be used to match against everything after the last '/' and before the first '?' or '#'.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.HTTPIngressRuleValueV1Beta1.Paths
member.summary: A collection of paths that map requests to backends.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.IngressRuleV1Beta1
member.summary: IngressRule represents the rules mapping the paths under a specified host to the related backend services. Incoming requests are first evaluated for a host match, then routed to the backend associated with the matching IngressRuleValue.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.IngressRuleV1Beta1.Http
member.summary: Description not provided.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.IngressRuleV1Beta1.Host
member.summary: Host is the fully qualified domain name of a network host, as defined by RFC 3986. Note the following deviations from the "host" part of the URI as defined in the RFC: 1. IPs are not allowed. Currently an IngressRuleValue can only apply to the IP in the Spec of the parent Ingress. 2. The `:` delimiter is not respected because ports are not allowed. Currently the port of an Ingress is implicitly :80 for http and :443 for https. Both these may change in the future. Incoming requests are matched against the host before the IngressRuleValue. If the host is unspecified, the Ingress routes all traffic based on the specified IngressRuleValue.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.IngressSpecV1Beta1
member.summary: IngressSpec describes the Ingress the user wishes to exist.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.IngressSpecV1Beta1.Backend
member.summary: A default backend capable of servicing requests that don't match any rule. At least one of 'backend' or 'rules' must be specified. This field is optional to allow the loadbalancer controller or defaulting logic to specify a global default.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.IngressSpecV1Beta1.Rules
member.summary: A list of host rules used to configure the Ingress. If unspecified, or no rule matches, all traffic is sent to the default backend.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.IngressSpecV1Beta1.ShouldSerializeRules
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.IngressSpecV1Beta1.Tls
member.summary: TLS configuration. Currently the Ingress only supports a single TLS port, 443. If multiple members of this list specify different hosts, they will be multiplexed on the same port according to the hostname specified through the SNI TLS extension, if the ingress controller fulfilling the ingress supports SNI.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.IngressSpecV1Beta1.ShouldSerializeTls
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.IngressStatusV1Beta1
member.summary: IngressStatus describe the current state of the Ingress.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.IngressStatusV1Beta1.LoadBalancer
member.summary: LoadBalancer contains the current status of the load-balancer.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.IngressTLSV1Beta1
member.summary: IngressTLS describes the transport layer security associated with an Ingress.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.IngressTLSV1Beta1.SecretName
member.summary: SecretName is the name of the secret used to terminate SSL traffic on 443. Field is left optional to allow SSL routing based on SNI hostname alone. If the SNI host in a listener conflicts with the "Host" header field used by an IngressRule, the SNI host is used for termination and value of the Host header is used for routing.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.IngressTLSV1Beta1.Hosts
member.summary: Hosts are a list of hosts included in the TLS certificate. The values in this list must match the name/s used in the tlsSecret. Defaults to the wildcard host setting for the loadbalancer controller fulfilling this Ingress, if left unspecified.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.IngressTLSV1Beta1.ShouldSerializeHosts
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.summary: Ingress is a collection of rules that allow inbound connections to reach the endpoints defined by a backend. An Ingress can be configured to give services externally-reachable urls, load balance traffic, terminate SSL, offer name based virtual hosting etc.

member.summary: Pending is a list of initializers that must execute in order before this object is visible. When the last pending initializer is removed, and no failing result is set, the initializers struct will be set to nil and the object is considered as initialized and visible to all clients.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.InitializersV1.Result

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.JobSpecV1
member.summary: JobSpec describes how the job execution will look like.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.JobSpecV1.Template
member.summary: Describes the pod that will be created when executing a job. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/jobs-run-to-completion/

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.JobSpecV1.Parallelism
member.summary: Specifies the maximum desired number of pods the job should run at any given time. The actual number of pods running in steady state will be less than this number when ((.spec.completions - .status.successful) < .spec.parallelism), i.e. when the work left to do is less than max parallelism. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/jobs-run-to-completion/

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.JobSpecV1.ManualSelector
member.summary: manualSelector controls generation of pod labels and pod selectors. Leave `manualSelector` unset unless you are certain what you are doing. When false or unset, the system pick labels unique to this job and appends those labels to the pod template. When true, the user is responsible for picking unique labels and specifying the selector. Failure to pick a unique label may cause this and other jobs to not function correctly. However, You may see `manualSelector=true` in jobs that were created with the old `extensions/v1beta1` API. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/jobs-run-to-completion/#specifying-your-own-pod-selector

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.JobSpecV1.Selector
member.summary: A label query over pods that should match the pod count. Normally, the system sets this field for you. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.JobSpecV1.ActiveDeadlineSeconds
member.summary: Specifies the duration in seconds relative to the startTime that the job may be active before the system tries to terminate it; value must be positive integer

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.JobSpecV1.Completions
member.summary: Specifies the desired number of successfully finished pods the job should be run with. Setting to nil means that the success of any pod signals the success of all pods, and allows parallelism to have any positive value. Setting to 1 means that parallelism is limited to 1 and the success of that pod signals the success of the job. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/jobs-run-to-completion/

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.JobSpecV1.BackoffLimit
member.summary: Specifies the number of retries before marking this job failed. Defaults to 6

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.JobSpecV1.TtlSecondsAfterFinished
member.summary: Limits the lifetime of a Job that has finished execution (either Complete or Failed). If this field is set, ttlSecondsAfterFinished after the Job finishes, it is eligible to be automatically deleted. When the Job is being deleted, its lifecycle guarantees (e.g. finalizers) will be honored. If this field is unset, the Job won't be automatically deleted. If this field is set to zero, the Job becomes eligible to be deleted immediately after it finishes. This field is alpha-level and is only honored by servers that enable the TTLAfterFinished feature.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.JobStatusV1
member.summary: JobStatus represents the current state of a Job.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.JobStatusV1.Failed
member.summary: The number of pods which reached phase Failed.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.JobStatusV1.Succeeded
member.summary: The number of pods which reached phase Succeeded.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.JobStatusV1.Active
member.summary: The number of actively running pods.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.JobStatusV1.CompletionTime
member.summary: Represents time when the job was completed. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.JobStatusV1.StartTime
member.summary: Represents time when the job was acknowledged by the job controller. It is not guaranteed to be set in happens-before order across separate operations. It is represented in RFC3339 form and is in UTC.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.JobStatusV1.Conditions
member.summary: The latest available observations of an object's current state. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/workloads/controllers/jobs-run-to-completion/

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.KeyToPathV1
member.summary: Maps a string key to a path within a volume.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.KeyToPathV1.Mode
member.summary: Optional: mode bits to use on this file, must be a value between 0 and 0777. If not specified, the volume defaultMode will be used. This might be in conflict with other options that affect the file mode, like fsGroup, and the result can be other mode bits set.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.KeyToPathV1.Path
member.summary: The relative path of the file to map the key to. May not be an absolute path. May not contain the path element '..'. May not start with the string '..'.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.KeyToPathV1.Key
member.summary: The key to project.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.LabelSelectorRequirementV1
member.summary: A label selector requirement is a selector that contains values, a key, and an operator that relates the key and values.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.LabelSelectorRequirementV1.Operator
member.summary: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.LabelSelectorRequirementV1.Values
member.summary: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.LabelSelectorRequirementV1.ShouldSerializeValues
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.LabelSelectorRequirementV1.Key
member.summary: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.LabelSelectorV1
member.summary: A label selector is a label query over a set of resources. The result of matchLabels and matchExpressions are ANDed. An empty label selector matches all objects. A null label selector matches no objects.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.LabelSelectorV1.MatchExpressions
member.summary: matchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.LabelSelectorV1.ShouldSerializeMatchExpressions
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.LabelSelectorV1.MatchLabels
member.summary: matchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.LabelSelectorV1.ShouldSerializeMatchLabels
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.LifecycleV1
member.summary: Lifecycle describes actions that the management system should take in response to container lifecycle events. For the PostStart and PreStop lifecycle handlers, management of the container blocks until the action is complete, unless the container process fails, in which case the handler is aborted.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.LifecycleV1.PreStop
member.summary: PreStop is called immediately before a container is terminated. The container is terminated after the handler completes. The reason for termination is passed to the handler. Regardless of the outcome of the handler, the container is eventually terminated. Other management of the container blocks until the hook completes. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/container-lifecycle-hooks/#container-hooks

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.LifecycleV1.PostStart
member.summary: PostStart is called immediately after a container is created. If the handler fails, the container is terminated and restarted according to its restart policy. Other management of the container blocks until the hook completes. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/container-lifecycle-hooks/#container-hooks

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.ListMetaV1
member.summary: ListMeta describes metadata that synthetic resources must have, including lists and various status objects. A resource may have only one of {ObjectMeta, ListMeta}.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ListMetaV1.Continue
member.summary: continue may be set if the user set a limit on the number of items returned, and indicates that the server has more data available. The value is opaque and may be used to issue another request to the endpoint that served this list to retrieve the next set of available objects. Continuing a list may not be possible if the server configuration has changed or more than a few minutes have passed. The resourceVersion field returned when using this continue value will be identical to the value in the first response.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ListMetaV1.SelfLink
member.summary: selfLink is a URL representing this object. Populated by the system. Read-only.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ListMetaV1.ResourceVersion
member.summary: String that identifies the server's internal version of this object that can be used by clients to determine when objects have changed. Value must be treated as opaque by clients and passed unmodified back to the server. Populated by the system. Read-only. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#concurrency-control-and-consistency

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.LocalSubjectAccessReviewV1
member.summary: LocalSubjectAccessReview checks whether or not a user or group can perform an action in a given namespace. Having a namespace scoped resource makes it much easier to grant namespace scoped policy that includes permissions checking.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.LocalSubjectAccessReviewV1.Spec
member.summary: Spec holds information about the request being evaluated. spec.namespace must be equal to the namespace you made the request against. If empty, it is defaulted.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.LocalSubjectAccessReviewV1.Status
member.summary: Status is filled in by the server and indicates whether the request is allowed or not

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.LocalSubjectAccessReviewV1Beta1
member.summary: LocalSubjectAccessReview checks whether or not a user or group can perform an action in a given namespace. Having a namespace scoped resource makes it much easier to grant namespace scoped policy that includes permissions checking.

member.summary: Spec holds information about the request being evaluated. spec.namespace must be equal to the namespace you made the request against. If empty, it is defaulted.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.LocalVolumeSourceV1
member.summary: Local represents directly-attached storage with node affinity (Beta feature)

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.LocalVolumeSourceV1.Path
member.summary: The full path to the volume on the node. It can be either a directory or block device (disk, partition, ...). Directories can be represented only by PersistentVolume with VolumeMode=Filesystem. Block devices can be represented only by VolumeMode=Block, which also requires the BlockVolume alpha feature gate to be enabled.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.MetricSpecV2Beta1
member.summary: MetricSpec specifies how to scale based on a single metric (only `type` and one other matching field should be set at once).

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.MetricSpecV2Beta1.Resource
member.summary: resource refers to a resource metric (such as those specified in requests and limits) known to Kubernetes describing each pod in the current scale target (e.g. CPU or memory). Such metrics are built in to Kubernetes, and have special scaling options on top of those available to normal per-pod metrics using the "pods" source.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.MetricSpecV2Beta1.Type
member.summary: type is the type of metric source. It should be one of "Object", "Pods" or "Resource", each mapping to a matching field in the object.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.MetricSpecV2Beta1.External
member.summary: external refers to a global metric that is not associated with any Kubernetes object. It allows autoscaling based on information coming from components running outside of cluster (for example length of queue in cloud messaging service, or QPS from loadbalancer running outside of cluster).

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.MetricSpecV2Beta1.Pods
member.summary: pods refers to a metric describing each pod in the current scale target (for example, transactions-processed-per-second). The values will be averaged together before being compared to the target value.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.MetricSpecV2Beta1.Object
member.summary: object refers to a metric describing a single kubernetes object (for example, hits-per-second on an Ingress object).

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.MetricStatusV2Beta1
member.summary: MetricStatus describes the last-read state of a single metric.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.MetricStatusV2Beta1.Resource
member.summary: resource refers to a resource metric (such as those specified in requests and limits) known to Kubernetes describing each pod in the current scale target (e.g. CPU or memory). Such metrics are built in to Kubernetes, and have special scaling options on top of those available to normal per-pod metrics using the "pods" source.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.MetricStatusV2Beta1.Type
member.summary: type is the type of metric source. It will be one of "Object", "Pods" or "Resource", each corresponds to a matching field in the object.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.MetricStatusV2Beta1.External
member.summary: external refers to a global metric that is not associated with any Kubernetes object. It allows autoscaling based on information coming from components running outside of cluster (for example length of queue in cloud messaging service, or QPS from loadbalancer running outside of cluster).

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.MetricStatusV2Beta1.Pods
member.summary: pods refers to a metric describing each pod in the current scale target (for example, transactions-processed-per-second). The values will be averaged together before being compared to the target value.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.MetricStatusV2Beta1.Object
member.summary: object refers to a metric describing a single kubernetes object (for example, hits-per-second on an Ingress object).

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.NetworkPolicyEgressRuleV1
member.summary: NetworkPolicyEgressRule describes a particular set of traffic that is allowed out of pods matched by a NetworkPolicySpec's podSelector. The traffic must match both ports and to. This type is beta-level in 1.8

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.NetworkPolicyEgressRuleV1.To
member.summary: List of destinations for outgoing traffic of pods selected for this rule. Items in this list are combined using a logical OR operation. If this field is empty or missing, this rule matches all destinations (traffic not restricted by destination). If this field is present and contains at least one item, this rule allows traffic only if the traffic matches at least one item in the to list.

member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.NetworkPolicyEgressRuleV1.Ports
member.summary: List of destination ports for outgoing traffic. Each item in this list is combined using a logical OR. If this field is empty or missing, this rule matches all ports (traffic not restricted by port). If this field is present and contains at least one item, then this rule allows traffic only if the traffic matches at least one port in the list.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.NetworkPolicyPeerV1
member.summary: NetworkPolicyPeer describes a peer to allow traffic from. Only certain combinations of fields are allowed

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.NetworkPolicyPeerV1.IpBlock
member.summary: IPBlock defines policy on a particular IPBlock. If this field is set then neither of the other fields can be.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.NetworkPolicyPeerV1.NamespaceSelector
member.summary:
Selects Namespaces using cluster-scoped labels. This field follows standard label selector semantics; if present but empty, it selects all namespaces.
If PodSelector is also set, then the NetworkPolicyPeer as a whole selects the Pods matching PodSelector in the Namespaces selected by NamespaceSelector. Otherwise it selects all Pods in the Namespaces selected by NamespaceSelector.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.NetworkPolicyPeerV1.PodSelector
member.summary:
This is a label selector which selects Pods. This field follows standard label selector semantics; if present but empty, it selects all pods.
If NamespaceSelector is also set, then the NetworkPolicyPeer as a whole selects the Pods matching PodSelector in the Namespaces selected by NamespaceSelector. Otherwise it selects the Pods matching PodSelector in the policy's own Namespace.

member.summary: DEPRECATED 1.9 - This group version of NetworkPolicyPeer is deprecated by networking/v1/NetworkPolicyPeer.

member.summary: IPBlock defines policy on a particular IPBlock. If this field is set then neither of the other fields can be.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.NetworkPolicyPeerV1Beta1.NamespaceSelector
member.summary:
Selects Namespaces using cluster-scoped labels. This field follows standard label selector semantics; if present but empty, it selects all namespaces.
If PodSelector is also set, then the NetworkPolicyPeer as a whole selects the Pods matching PodSelector in the Namespaces selected by NamespaceSelector. Otherwise it selects all Pods in the Namespaces selected by NamespaceSelector.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.NetworkPolicyPeerV1Beta1.PodSelector
member.summary:
This is a label selector which selects Pods. This field follows standard label selector semantics; if present but empty, it selects all pods.
If NamespaceSelector is also set, then the NetworkPolicyPeer as a whole selects the Pods matching PodSelector in the Namespaces selected by NamespaceSelector. Otherwise it selects the Pods matching PodSelector in the policy's own Namespace.

member.summary: NetworkPolicyPort describes a port to allow traffic on
