member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.SelfSubjectRulesReviewV1
member.summary: SelfSubjectRulesReview enumerates the set of actions the current user can perform within a namespace. The returned list of actions may be incomplete depending on the server's authorization mode, and any errors experienced during the evaluation. SelfSubjectRulesReview should be used by UIs to show/hide actions, or to quickly let an end user reason about their permissions. It should NOT Be used by external systems to drive authorization decisions as this raises confused deputy, cache lifetime/revocation, and correctness concerns. SubjectAccessReview, and LocalAccessReview are the correct way to defer authorization decisions to the API server.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SelfSubjectRulesReviewV1.Spec

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SelfSubjectRulesReviewV1.Status

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.ServiceAccountTokenProjectionV1
member.summary: ServiceAccountTokenProjection represents a projected service account token volume. This projection can be used to insert a service account token into the pods runtime filesystem for use against APIs (Kubernetes API Server or otherwise).

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceAccountTokenProjectionV1.Audience
member.summary: Audience is the intended audience of the token. A recipient of a token must identify itself with an identifier specified in the audience of the token, and otherwise should reject the token. The audience defaults to the identifier of the apiserver.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceAccountTokenProjectionV1.Path
member.summary: Path is the path relative to the mount point of the file to project the token into.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceAccountTokenProjectionV1.ExpirationSeconds
member.summary: ExpirationSeconds is the requested duration of validity of the service account token. As the token approaches expiration, the kubelet volume plugin will proactively rotate the service account token. The kubelet will start trying to rotate the token if the token is older than 80 percent of its time to live or if the token is older than 24 hours.Defaults to 1 hour and must be at least 10 minutes.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.ServiceAccountV1
member.summary: ServiceAccount binds together: * a name, understood by users, and perhaps by peripheral systems, for an identity * a principal that can be authenticated and authorized * a set of secrets

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceAccountV1.AutomountServiceAccountToken
member.summary: AutomountServiceAccountToken indicates whether pods running as this service account should have an API token automatically mounted. Can be overridden at the pod level.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceAccountV1.ImagePullSecrets
member.summary: ImagePullSecrets is a list of references to secrets in the same namespace to use for pulling any images in pods that reference this ServiceAccount. ImagePullSecrets are distinct from Secrets because Secrets can be mounted in the pod, but ImagePullSecrets are only accessed by the kubelet. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/containers/images/#specifying-imagepullsecrets-on-a-pod

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.ServiceAccountV1.ShouldSerializeImagePullSecrets
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceAccountV1.Secrets
member.summary: Secrets is the list of secrets allowed to be used by pods running using this ServiceAccount. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/secret

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.ServiceAccountV1.ShouldSerializeSecrets
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.ServiceListV1
member.summary: ServiceList holds a list of services.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceListV1.Items
member.summary: List of services

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.ServicePortV1
member.summary: ServicePort contains information on service's port.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServicePortV1.Name
member.summary: The name of this port within the service. This must be a DNS_LABEL. All ports within a ServiceSpec must have unique names. This maps to the 'Name' field in EndpointPort objects. Optional if only one ServicePort is defined on this service.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServicePortV1.Protocol
member.summary: The IP protocol for this port. Supports "TCP" and "UDP". Default is TCP.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServicePortV1.NodePort
member.summary: The port on each node on which this service is exposed when type=NodePort or LoadBalancer. Usually assigned by the system. If specified, it will be allocated to the service if unused or else creation of the service will fail. Default is to auto-allocate a port if the ServiceType of this Service requires one. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#type-nodeport

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServicePortV1.Port
member.summary: The port that will be exposed by this service.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServicePortV1.TargetPort
member.summary: Number or name of the port to access on the pods targeted by the service. Number must be in the range 1 to 65535. Name must be an IANA_SVC_NAME. If this is a string, it will be looked up as a named port in the target Pod's container ports. If this is not specified, the value of the 'port' field is used (an identity map). This field is ignored for services with clusterIP=None, and should be omitted or set equal to the 'port' field. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#defining-a-service

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.ServiceReferenceV1
member.summary: ServiceReference holds a reference to Service.legacy.k8s.io

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceReferenceV1.Name
member.summary: Name is the name of the service

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceReferenceV1.Namespace
member.summary: Namespace is the namespace of the service

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.ServiceReferenceV1Beta1
member.summary: ServiceReference holds a reference to Service.legacy.k8s.io

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceReferenceV1Beta1.Name
member.summary: Name is the name of the service

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceReferenceV1Beta1.Namespace
member.summary: Namespace is the namespace of the service

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1
member.summary: ServiceSpec describes the attributes that a user creates on a service.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.ClusterIP
member.summary: clusterIP is the IP address of the service and is usually assigned randomly by the master. If an address is specified manually and is not in use by others, it will be allocated to the service; otherwise, creation of the service will fail. This field can not be changed through updates. Valid values are "None", empty string (""), or a valid IP address. "None" can be specified for headless services when proxying is not required. Only applies to types ClusterIP, NodePort, and LoadBalancer. Ignored if type is ExternalName. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#virtual-ips-and-service-proxies

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.LoadBalancerIP
member.summary: Only applies to Service Type: LoadBalancer LoadBalancer will get created with the IP specified in this field. This feature depends on whether the underlying cloud-provider supports specifying the loadBalancerIP when a load balancer is created. This field will be ignored if the cloud-provider does not support the feature.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.ExternalName
member.summary: externalName is the external reference that kubedns or equivalent will return as a CNAME record for this service. No proxying will be involved. Must be a valid RFC-1123 hostname (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc1123) and requires Type to be ExternalName.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.Type
member.summary: type determines how the Service is exposed. Defaults to ClusterIP. Valid options are ExternalName, ClusterIP, NodePort, and LoadBalancer. "ExternalName" maps to the specified externalName. "ClusterIP" allocates a cluster-internal IP address for load-balancing to endpoints. Endpoints are determined by the selector or if that is not specified, by manual construction of an Endpoints object. If clusterIP is "None", no virtual IP is allocated and the endpoints are published as a set of endpoints rather than a stable IP. "NodePort" builds on ClusterIP and allocates a port on every node which routes to the clusterIP. "LoadBalancer" builds on NodePort and creates an external load-balancer (if supported in the current cloud) which routes to the clusterIP. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#publishing-services---service-types

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.SessionAffinityConfig
member.summary: sessionAffinityConfig contains the configurations of session affinity.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.Selector
member.summary: Route service traffic to pods with label keys and values matching this selector. If empty or not present, the service is assumed to have an external process managing its endpoints, which Kubernetes will not modify. Only applies to types ClusterIP, NodePort, and LoadBalancer. Ignored if type is ExternalName. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.ShouldSerializeSelector
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.ExternalIPs
member.summary: externalIPs is a list of IP addresses for which nodes in the cluster will also accept traffic for this service. These IPs are not managed by Kubernetes. The user is responsible for ensuring that traffic arrives at a node with this IP. A common example is external load-balancers that are not part of the Kubernetes system.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.ShouldSerializeExternalIPs
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.LoadBalancerSourceRanges
member.summary: If specified and supported by the platform, this will restrict traffic through the cloud-provider load-balancer will be restricted to the specified client IPs. This field will be ignored if the cloud-provider does not support the feature." More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/access-application-cluster/configure-cloud-provider-firewall/

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.ShouldSerializeLoadBalancerSourceRanges
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.Ports
member.summary: The list of ports that are exposed by this service. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#virtual-ips-and-service-proxies

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.ShouldSerializePorts
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.PublishNotReadyAddresses
member.summary: publishNotReadyAddresses, when set to true, indicates that DNS implementations must publish the notReadyAddresses of subsets for the Endpoints associated with the Service. The default value is false. The primary use case for setting this field is to use a StatefulSet's Headless Service to propagate SRV records for its Pods without respect to their readiness for purpose of peer discovery.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.HealthCheckNodePort
member.summary: healthCheckNodePort specifies the healthcheck nodePort for the service. If not specified, HealthCheckNodePort is created by the service api backend with the allocated nodePort. Will use user-specified nodePort value if specified by the client. Only effects when Type is set to LoadBalancer and ExternalTrafficPolicy is set to Local.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.ExternalTrafficPolicy
member.summary: externalTrafficPolicy denotes if this Service desires to route external traffic to node-local or cluster-wide endpoints. "Local" preserves the client source IP and avoids a second hop for LoadBalancer and Nodeport type services, but risks potentially imbalanced traffic spreading. "Cluster" obscures the client source IP and may cause a second hop to another node, but should have good overall load-spreading.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceSpecV1.SessionAffinity
member.summary: Supports "ClientIP" and "None". Used to maintain session affinity. Enable client IP based session affinity. Must be ClientIP or None. Defaults to None. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/#virtual-ips-and-service-proxies

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.ServiceStatusV1
member.summary: ServiceStatus represents the current status of a service.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceStatusV1.LoadBalancer
member.summary: LoadBalancer contains the current status of the load-balancer, if one is present.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.ServiceV1
member.summary: Service is a named abstraction of software service (for example, mysql) consisting of local port (for example 3306) that the proxy listens on, and the selector that determines which pods will answer requests sent through the proxy.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceV1.Spec
member.summary: Spec defines the behavior of a service. https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#spec-and-status

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.ServiceV1.Status
member.summary: Most recently observed status of the service. Populated by the system. Read-only. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#spec-and-status

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.SessionAffinityConfigV1
member.summary: SessionAffinityConfig represents the configurations of session affinity.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SessionAffinityConfigV1.ClientIP
member.summary: clientIP contains the configurations of Client IP based session affinity.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetSpecV1
member.summary: A StatefulSetSpec is the specification of a StatefulSet.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetSpecV1.ServiceName
member.summary: serviceName is the name of the service that governs this StatefulSet. This service must exist before the StatefulSet, and is responsible for the network identity of the set. Pods get DNS/hostnames that follow the pattern: pod-specific-string.serviceName.default.svc.cluster.local where "pod-specific-string" is managed by the StatefulSet controller.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetSpecV1.Template
member.summary: template is the object that describes the pod that will be created if insufficient replicas are detected. Each pod stamped out by the StatefulSet will fulfill this Template, but have a unique identity from the rest of the StatefulSet.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetSpecV1.Selector
member.summary: selector is a label query over pods that should match the replica count. It must match the pod template's labels. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/labels/#label-selectors

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetSpecV1.Replicas
member.summary: replicas is the desired number of replicas of the given Template. These are replicas in the sense that they are instantiations of the same Template, but individual replicas also have a consistent identity. If unspecified, defaults to 1.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetSpecV1.VolumeClaimTemplates
member.summary: volumeClaimTemplates is a list of claims that pods are allowed to reference. The StatefulSet controller is responsible for mapping network identities to claims in a way that maintains the identity of a pod. Every claim in this list must have at least one matching (by name) volumeMount in one container in the template. A claim in this list takes precedence over any volumes in the template, with the same name.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetSpecV1.ShouldSerializeVolumeClaimTemplates
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetSpecV1.RevisionHistoryLimit
member.summary: revisionHistoryLimit is the maximum number of revisions that will be maintained in the StatefulSet's revision history. The revision history consists of all revisions not represented by a currently applied StatefulSetSpec version. The default value is 10.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetSpecV1.PodManagementPolicy
member.summary: podManagementPolicy controls how pods are created during initial scale up, when replacing pods on nodes, or when scaling down. The default policy is `OrderedReady`, where pods are created in increasing order (pod-0, then pod-1, etc) and the controller will wait until each pod is ready before continuing. When scaling down, the pods are removed in the opposite order. The alternative policy is `Parallel` which will create pods in parallel to match the desired scale without waiting, and on scale down will delete all pods at once.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetSpecV1.UpdateStrategy
member.summary: updateStrategy indicates the StatefulSetUpdateStrategy that will be employed to update Pods in the StatefulSet when a revision is made to Template.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetSpecV1Beta1
member.summary: A StatefulSetSpec is the specification of a StatefulSet.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetStatusV1
member.summary: StatefulSetStatus represents the current state of a StatefulSet.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetStatusV1.CurrentRevision
member.summary: currentRevision, if not empty, indicates the version of the StatefulSet used to generate Pods in the sequence [0,currentReplicas).

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetStatusV1.ObservedGeneration
member.summary: observedGeneration is the most recent generation observed for this StatefulSet. It corresponds to the StatefulSet's generation, which is updated on mutation by the API Server.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetStatusV1.UpdateRevision
member.summary: updateRevision, if not empty, indicates the version of the StatefulSet used to generate Pods in the sequence [replicas-updatedReplicas,replicas)

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetStatusV1.Conditions
member.summary: Represents the latest available observations of a statefulset's current state.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetStatusV1.ShouldSerializeConditions
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetStatusV1.CurrentReplicas
member.summary: currentReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller from the StatefulSet version indicated by currentRevision.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetStatusV1.ReadyReplicas
member.summary: readyReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller that have a Ready Condition.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetStatusV1.Replicas
member.summary: replicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetStatusV1.UpdatedReplicas
member.summary: updatedReplicas is the number of Pods created by the StatefulSet controller from the StatefulSet version indicated by updateRevision.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetStatusV1.CollisionCount
member.summary: collisionCount is the count of hash collisions for the StatefulSet. The StatefulSet controller uses this field as a collision avoidance mechanism when it needs to create the name for the newest ControllerRevision.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetStatusV1Beta1.CollisionCount

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetStatusV1Beta2.ObservedGeneration

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetStatusV1Beta2.UpdateRevision

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetV1
member.summary: StatefulSet represents a set of pods with consistent identities. Identities are defined as: - Network: A single stable DNS and hostname. - Storage: As many VolumeClaims as requested. The StatefulSet guarantees that a given network identity will always map to the same storage identity.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetV1.Spec
member.summary: Spec defines the desired identities of pods in this set.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatefulSetV1.Status
member.summary: Status is the current status of Pods in this StatefulSet. This data may be out of date by some window of time.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.StatusCauseV1
member.summary: StatusCause provides more information about an api.Status failure, including cases when multiple errors are encountered.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatusCauseV1.Field
member.summary:
The field of the resource that has caused this error, as named by its JSON serialization. May include dot and postfix notation for nested attributes. Arrays are zero-indexed. Fields may appear more than once in an array of causes due to fields having multiple errors. Optional.
Examples: "name" - the field "name" on the current resource "items[0].name" - the field "name" on the first array entry in "items"

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatusCauseV1.Message
member.summary: A human-readable description of the cause of the error. This field may be presented as-is to a reader.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatusCauseV1.Reason
member.summary: A machine-readable description of the cause of the error. If this value is empty there is no information available.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.StatusDetailsV1
member.summary: StatusDetails is a set of additional properties that MAY be set by the server to provide additional information about a response. The Reason field of a Status object defines what attributes will be set. Clients must ignore fields that do not match the defined type of each attribute, and should assume that any attribute may be empty, invalid, or under defined.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatusDetailsV1.Kind
member.summary: The kind attribute of the resource associated with the status StatusReason. On some operations may differ from the requested resource Kind. More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

member.summary: UID of the resource. (when there is a single resource which can be described). More info: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/identifiers#uids

member.summary: The name attribute of the resource associated with the status StatusReason (when there is a single name which can be described).

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatusDetailsV1.Group
member.summary: The group attribute of the resource associated with the status StatusReason.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StatusDetailsV1.Causes
member.summary: The Causes array includes more details associated with the StatusReason failure. Not all StatusReasons may provide detailed causes.

member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.summary: If specified, the time in seconds before the operation should be retried. Some errors may indicate the client must take an alternate action - for those errors this field may indicate how long to wait before taking the alternate action.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.StorageClassV1
member.summary:
StorageClass describes the parameters for a class of storage for which PersistentVolumes can be dynamically provisioned.
StorageClasses are non-namespaced; the name of the storage class according to etcd is in ObjectMeta.Name.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StorageClassV1.VolumeBindingMode
member.summary: VolumeBindingMode indicates how PersistentVolumeClaims should be provisioned and bound. When unset, VolumeBindingImmediate is used. This field is alpha-level and is only honored by servers that enable the VolumeScheduling feature.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StorageClassV1.AllowVolumeExpansion
member.summary: AllowVolumeExpansion shows whether the storage class allow volume expand

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StorageClassV1.Provisioner
member.summary: Provisioner indicates the type of the provisioner.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StorageClassV1.AllowedTopologies
member.summary: Restrict the node topologies where volumes can be dynamically provisioned. Each volume plugin defines its own supported topology specifications. An empty TopologySelectorTerm list means there is no topology restriction. This field is alpha-level and is only honored by servers that enable the DynamicProvisioningScheduling feature.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.StorageClassV1.ShouldSerializeAllowedTopologies
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StorageClassV1.MountOptions
member.summary: Dynamically provisioned PersistentVolumes of this storage class are created with these mountOptions, e.g. ["ro", "soft"]. Not validated - mount of the PVs will simply fail if one is invalid.

member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.summary: Parameters holds the parameters for the provisioner that should create volumes of this storage class.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.StorageOSPersistentVolumeSourceV1
member.summary: Represents a StorageOS persistent volume resource.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StorageOSPersistentVolumeSourceV1.FsType
member.summary: Filesystem type to mount. Must be a filesystem type supported by the host operating system. Ex. "ext4", "xfs", "ntfs". Implicitly inferred to be "ext4" if unspecified.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StorageOSPersistentVolumeSourceV1.VolumeName
member.summary: VolumeName is the human-readable name of the StorageOS volume. Volume names are only unique within a namespace.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StorageOSPersistentVolumeSourceV1.VolumeNamespace
member.summary: VolumeNamespace specifies the scope of the volume within StorageOS. If no namespace is specified then the Pod's namespace will be used. This allows the Kubernetes name scoping to be mirrored within StorageOS for tighter integration. Set VolumeName to any name to override the default behaviour. Set to "default" if you are not using namespaces within StorageOS. Namespaces that do not pre-exist within StorageOS will be created.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StorageOSPersistentVolumeSourceV1.SecretRef
member.summary: SecretRef specifies the secret to use for obtaining the StorageOS API credentials. If not specified, default values will be attempted.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.StorageOSPersistentVolumeSourceV1.ReadOnly
member.summary: Defaults to false (read/write). ReadOnly here will force the ReadOnly setting in VolumeMounts.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.StorageOSVolumeSourceV1

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.SubjectAccessReviewStatusV1
member.summary: SubjectAccessReviewStatus

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectAccessReviewStatusV1.Allowed
member.summary: Allowed is required. True if the action would be allowed, false otherwise.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectAccessReviewStatusV1.Denied
member.summary: Denied is optional. True if the action would be denied, otherwise false. If both allowed is false and denied is false, then the authorizer has no opinion on whether to authorize the action. Denied may not be true if Allowed is true.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectAccessReviewStatusV1.Reason
member.summary: Reason is optional. It indicates why a request was allowed or denied.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectAccessReviewStatusV1.EvaluationError
member.summary: EvaluationError is an indication that some error occurred during the authorization check. It is entirely possible to get an error and be able to continue determine authorization status in spite of it. For instance, RBAC can be missing a role, but enough roles are still present and bound to reason about the request.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.SubjectRulesReviewStatusV1
member.summary: SubjectRulesReviewStatus contains the result of a rules check. This check can be incomplete depending on the set of authorizers the server is configured with and any errors experienced during evaluation. Because authorization rules are additive, if a rule appears in a list it's safe to assume the subject has that permission, even if that list is incomplete.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectRulesReviewStatusV1.Incomplete
member.summary: Incomplete is true when the rules returned by this call are incomplete. This is most commonly encountered when an authorizer, such as an external authorizer, doesn't support rules evaluation.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectRulesReviewStatusV1.EvaluationError
member.summary: EvaluationError can appear in combination with Rules. It indicates an error occurred during rule evaluation, such as an authorizer that doesn't support rule evaluation, and that ResourceRules and/or NonResourceRules may be incomplete.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectRulesReviewStatusV1.NonResourceRules
member.summary: NonResourceRules is the list of actions the subject is allowed to perform on non-resources. The list ordering isn't significant, may contain duplicates, and possibly be incomplete.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectRulesReviewStatusV1.ResourceRules
member.summary: ResourceRules is the list of actions the subject is allowed to perform on resources. The list ordering isn't significant, may contain duplicates, and possibly be incomplete.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.SubjectRulesReviewStatusV1Beta1
member.summary: SubjectRulesReviewStatus contains the result of a rules check. This check can be incomplete depending on the set of authorizers the server is configured with and any errors experienced during evaluation. Because authorization rules are additive, if a rule appears in a list it's safe to assume the subject has that permission, even if that list is incomplete.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectRulesReviewStatusV1Beta1.Incomplete
member.summary: Incomplete is true when the rules returned by this call are incomplete. This is most commonly encountered when an authorizer, such as an external authorizer, doesn't support rules evaluation.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectRulesReviewStatusV1Beta1.EvaluationError
member.summary: EvaluationError can appear in combination with Rules. It indicates an error occurred during rule evaluation, such as an authorizer that doesn't support rule evaluation, and that ResourceRules and/or NonResourceRules may be incomplete.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectRulesReviewStatusV1Beta1.NonResourceRules
member.summary: NonResourceRules is the list of actions the subject is allowed to perform on non-resources. The list ordering isn't significant, may contain duplicates, and possibly be incomplete.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectRulesReviewStatusV1Beta1.ResourceRules
member.summary: ResourceRules is the list of actions the subject is allowed to perform on resources. The list ordering isn't significant, may contain duplicates, and possibly be incomplete.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.SubjectV1
member.summary: Subject contains a reference to the object or user identities a role binding applies to. This can either hold a direct API object reference, or a value for non-objects such as user and group names.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectV1.Kind
member.summary: Kind of object being referenced. Values defined by this API group are "User", "Group", and "ServiceAccount". If the Authorizer does not recognized the kind value, the Authorizer should report an error.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectV1.Name
member.summary: Name of the object being referenced.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectV1.Namespace
member.summary: Namespace of the referenced object. If the object kind is non-namespace, such as "User" or "Group", and this value is not empty the Authorizer should report an error.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectV1.ApiGroup
member.summary: APIGroup holds the API group of the referenced subject. Defaults to "" for ServiceAccount subjects. Defaults to "rbac.authorization.k8s.io" for User and Group subjects.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.SubjectV1Alpha1
member.summary: Subject contains a reference to the object or user identities a role binding applies to. This can either hold a direct API object reference, or a value for non-objects such as user and group names.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectV1Alpha1.Name
member.summary: Name of the object being referenced.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectV1Alpha1.Namespace
member.summary: Namespace of the referenced object. If the object kind is non-namespace, such as "User" or "Group", and this value is not empty the Authorizer should report an error.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.SubjectV1Beta1
member.summary: Subject contains a reference to the object or user identities a role binding applies to. This can either hold a direct API object reference, or a value for non-objects such as user and group names.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SubjectV1Beta1.Kind
member.summary: Kind of object being referenced. Values defined by this API group are "User", "Group", and "ServiceAccount". If the Authorizer does not recognized the kind value, the Authorizer should report an error.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.SupplementalGroupsStrategyOptionsV1Beta1.Ranges
member.summary: ranges are the allowed ranges of supplemental groups. If you would like to force a single supplemental group then supply a single range with the same start and end. Required for MustRunAs.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.TaintV1.TimeAdded
member.summary: TimeAdded represents the time at which the taint was added. It is only written for NoExecute taints.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.TaintV1.Value
member.summary: Required. The taint value corresponding to the taint key.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.TaintV1.Effect
member.summary: Required. The effect of the taint on pods that do not tolerate the taint. Valid effects are NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule and NoExecute.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.TaintV1.Key
member.summary: Required. The taint key to be applied to a node.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.TCPSocketActionV1.Port

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.TolerationV1
member.summary: The pod this Toleration is attached to tolerates any taint that matches the triple <key,value,effect> using the matching operator <operator>.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.TolerationV1.Value
member.summary: Value is the taint value the toleration matches to. If the operator is Exists, the value should be empty, otherwise just a regular string.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.TolerationV1.Operator
member.summary: Operator represents a key's relationship to the value. Valid operators are Exists and Equal. Defaults to Equal. Exists is equivalent to wildcard for value, so that a pod can tolerate all taints of a particular category.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.TolerationV1.TolerationSeconds
member.summary: TolerationSeconds represents the period of time the toleration (which must be of effect NoExecute, otherwise this field is ignored) tolerates the taint. By default, it is not set, which means tolerate the taint forever (do not evict). Zero and negative values will be treated as 0 (evict immediately) by the system.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.TolerationV1.Effect
member.summary: Effect indicates the taint effect to match. Empty means match all taint effects. When specified, allowed values are NoSchedule, PreferNoSchedule and NoExecute.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.TolerationV1.Key
member.summary: Key is the taint key that the toleration applies to. Empty means match all taint keys. If the key is empty, operator must be Exists; this combination means to match all values and all keys.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.TopologySelectorLabelRequirementV1
member.summary: A topology selector requirement is a selector that matches given label. This is an alpha feature and may change in the future.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.TopologySelectorLabelRequirementV1.Values
member.summary: An array of string values. One value must match the label to be selected. Each entry in Values is ORed.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.TopologySelectorLabelRequirementV1.Key
member.summary: The label key that the selector applies to.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.TopologySelectorTermV1
member.summary: A topology selector term represents the result of label queries. A null or empty topology selector term matches no objects. The requirements of them are ANDed. It provides a subset of functionality as NodeSelectorTerm. This is an alpha feature and may change in the future.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.TopologySelectorTermV1.MatchLabelExpressions
member.summary: A list of topology selector requirements by labels.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.TopologySelectorTermV1.ShouldSerializeMatchLabelExpressions
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

VolumeAttachment captures the intent to attach or detach the specified volume to/from the specified node.
VolumeAttachment objects are non-namespaced.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.VolumeV1.HostPath

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.WebhookClientConfigV1Beta1
member.summary: WebhookClientConfig contains the information to make a TLS connection with the webhook

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.WebhookClientConfigV1Beta1.CaBundle
member.summary: `caBundle` is a PEM encoded CA bundle which will be used to validate the webhook's server certificate. Required.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.WebhookClientConfigV1Beta1.Service
member.summary:
`service` is a reference to the service for this webhook. Either `service` or `url` must be specified.
If the webhook is running within the cluster, then you should use `service`.
Port 443 will be used if it is open, otherwise it is an error.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.WebhookClientConfigV1Beta1.Url
member.summary:
`url` gives the location of the webhook, in standard URL form (`[scheme://]host:port/path`). Exactly one of `url` or `service` must be specified.
The `host` should not refer to a service running in the cluster; use the `service` field instead. The host might be resolved via external DNS in some apiservers (e.g., `kube-apiserver` cannot resolve in-cluster DNS as that would be a layering violation). `host` may also be an IP address.
Please note that using `localhost` or `127.0.0.1` as a `host` is risky unless you take great care to run this webhook on all hosts which run an apiserver which might need to make calls to this webhook. Such installs are likely to be non-portable, i.e., not easy to turn up in a new cluster.
The scheme must be "https"; the URL must begin with "https://".
A path is optional, and if present may be any string permissible in a URL. You may use the path to pass an arbitrary string to the webhook, for example, a cluster identifier.
Attempting to use a user or basic auth e.g. "user:password@" is not allowed. Fragments ("#...") and query parameters ("?...") are not allowed, either.

member.name: T:KubeClient.Models.WebhookV1Beta1
member.summary: Webhook describes an admission webhook and the resources and operations it applies to.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.WebhookV1Beta1.Name
member.summary: The name of the admission webhook. Name should be fully qualified, e.g., imagepolicy.kubernetes.io, where "imagepolicy" is the name of the webhook, and kubernetes.io is the name of the organization. Required.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.WebhookV1Beta1.ClientConfig
member.summary: ClientConfig defines how to communicate with the hook. Required

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.WebhookV1Beta1.NamespaceSelector
P:KubeClient.Models.WebhookV1Beta1.Rules
member.summary: Rules describes what operations on what resources/subresources the webhook cares about. The webhook cares about an operation if it matches _any_ Rule. However, in order to prevent ValidatingAdmissionWebhooks and MutatingAdmissionWebhooks from putting the cluster in a state which cannot be recovered from without completely disabling the plugin, ValidatingAdmissionWebhooks and MutatingAdmissionWebhooks are never called on admission requests for ValidatingWebhookConfiguration and MutatingWebhookConfiguration objects.

member.name: M:KubeClient.Models.WebhookV1Beta1.ShouldSerializeRules
member.summary: Determine whether the property should be serialised.

member.name: P:KubeClient.Models.WebhookV1Beta1.FailurePolicy
member.summary: FailurePolicy defines how unrecognized errors from the admission endpoint are handled - allowed values are Ignore or Fail. Defaults to Ignore.

member.summary: Required. A pod affinity term, associated with the corresponding weight.

member.summary: weight associated with matching the corresponding podAffinityTerm, in the range 1-100.
